item.title: Go Digit General Insurance Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Bearish Trend Ahead
item.description: Go Digit General Insurance Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) crosses below the 200-day moving average. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting deteriorating momentum and raising concerns about the stock's medium to long-term outlook. Time: 11 minutes ago

item.title: Mixed Earnings Landscape as 802 Companies Report Dec-2025 Quarterly Results
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has delivered a mixed bag of results with 802 companies declaring their numbers. While the overall proportion of positive results has improved to 50.0%, this marks a modest recovery from the subdued performance seen in the previous three quarters. Sectoral and market capitalisation-wise disparities continue to shape the earnings landscape, reflecting varied growth trajectories across industries and company sizes. Time: 12 minutes ago

item.title: Brigade Enterprises Q3 FY26: Growth Momentum Masks Valuation Concerns Amid Bearish Technicals
item.description: Brigade Enterprises Ltd., one of South India's leading real estate developers, reported a consolidated net profit of ₹186.52 crores for Q3 FY26, marking a sequential improvement of 14.78% from Q2 FY26's ₹162.50 crores. However, the year-on-year comparison reveals a concerning 21.05% decline from ₹236.24 crores in Q3 FY25, raising questions about the sustainability of the company's growth trajectory despite strong operational metrics. Time: 27 minutes ago

item.title: Softtech Engineers Ltd Falls to 52-Week Low Amidst Continued Downtrend
item.description: Softtech Engineers Ltd has declined to a fresh 52-week low, closing near Rs 276.25, marking a significant milestone in its ongoing downward trajectory. The stock’s recent performance reflects a series of challenges impacting its valuation and market standing within the Computers - Software & Consulting sector. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Medi Assist Healthcare Services Ltd Stock Hits 52-Week Low Amidst Continued Downtrend
item.description: Medi Assist Healthcare Services Ltd has touched a fresh 52-week low, closing just 0.86% above its lowest price of Rs 394, marking a significant phase of decline for the insurance sector stock amid broader market pressures and company-specific factors. Time: 2 hours ago
